## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
plot(0, 0, type = "n", xlim = c(-10, 10), ylim = c(-10, 10), 
     xlab = "X-axis", ylab = "Y-axis", asp = 1, xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n")

# Add axes
abline(h = 0, v = 0, col = "black", lwd = 2)  

# Add grid lines at each integer
abline(h = -10:10, col = "lightgray", lty = "dotted")
abline(v = -10:10, col = "lightgray", lty = "dotted")

# Custom integer ticks
axis(1, at = -10:10, labels = -10:10)
axis(2, at = -10:10, labels = -10:10, las = 1)

```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
coord = ggplot() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = -10:10, color = "lightgray", linetype = "dotted") +  # Grid lines
  geom_vline(xintercept = -10:10, color = "lightgray", linetype = "dotted") +  
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color = "black", linetype = "solid", size = 1) +  # X-axis
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, color = "black", linetype = "solid", size = 1) +  # Y-axis
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = -10:10) + 
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = -10:10) +
  coord_fixed() +  # Ensures a square aspect ratio
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(panel.grid = element_blank())  # Remove default ggplot2 grid

```

```{r}
build_coords <- function(){
  coord = ggplot() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = -10:10, color = "lightgray", linetype = "dotted") +  # Grid lines
  geom_vline(xintercept = -10:10, color = "lightgray", linetype = "dotted") +  
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color = "black", linetype = "solid", size = 1) +  # X-axis
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, color = "black", linetype = "solid", size = 1) +  # Y-axis
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = -10:10) + 
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = -10:10) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(-10, 10), ylim = c(-10, 10)) +  # Ensures a square aspect ratio
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(panel.grid = element_blank())
  
  return(coord)
}
```

```{r}
add_vector <- function(vector, coord, color){
  plot = coord +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 0, y = 0),
               xend = vector[1], yend = vector[2], color=color) +
  geom_text(aes(x = vector[1], y = vector[2]), label = paste0("(", vector[1], ', ', vector[2], ")"), color=color)
  
  return(plot)
}
```

```{r}
add_vector(vector_1, coord, 'blue')
```
```{r}
transform_vector <- function(vector, matrix, coord){
  
  t_vector <- solve(matrix, vector)
  
  plot <- add_vector(t_vector, coord, blue)

  return(plot)
}
```

                      0,-1), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)

                        0,1), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)

                       1,0), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)

# Apply a right-ward shear
shear <- matrix(c(1,0,
                  1,1), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)

# Reflect across line of symmetry

                    0,-1), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)
